item.title: Create Users
item.description:
This section explains how to create a user.

Prerequisites

You should have the User Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the User Management permission.

  2. Click Users and Roles.

  3. Click Users in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click Create on the page.

  5. In the Create User dialog, fill in the user’s information, and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Username

item.title: View User List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the user list.

Prerequisites

You should have the User Viewing permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the User Viewing permission.

  2. Click Users and Roles.

  3. Click Users in the left navigation pane.

    • The user list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: View User Details
item.description:
This section explains how to view user details.

Prerequisites

You should have the User Viewing permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the User Viewing permission.

  2. Click Users and Roles.

  3. Click Users in the left navigation pane.

  4. In the user list, click the name of a user to open its details page.

  5. In the Attributes area on the left side of the user details page, view the user’s attributes.

    Parameter Description

    Platform Role

item.title: Edit User Information
item.description:
This section explains how to edit user information.

You can edit the user’s email, platform role, and description. KubeSphere does not support editing the name of an already created user.

Prerequisites

You should have the User Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the User Management permission.

  2. Click Users and Roles.

  3. Click Users in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click to the right of a user, and then choose Edit from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Edit User dialog, edit the user’s information, and then click OK.

item.title: Change Email and Language
item.description:
This section explains how to change the email address and language for the current user.

Prerequisites

Get the username and password for the KubeSphere web console.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console.

  2. Click the current username in the top-right corner, and then select User Settings from the dropdown list.

  3. On the Basic Information tab, change the user’s email address and language.

    Parameter Description

    Email

item.title: Change User Password
item.description:
This section explains how to change user passwords.

Change Password for the Current User

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console.

  2. Click the current username in the top-right corner, then select User Settings from the drop-down list.

  3. Click the Password Settings tab to change the password for the current user.

    The password must contain at least one number, one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter, and one special character (~!@#$%^&*()-_=+\|[{}];:'",<.>/? or space). The length must be 8 to 64 characters.

item.title: Reset User Password
item.description:
This section provides guidance on resetting user passwords.

If a regular user forgets their password and is unable to log in to the KubeSphere web console, please refer to this document for instructions on how the administrator can change the user’s password.

If the platform administrator forgets their password, the following command needs to be executed on the host cluster to change the password for the specified account.

kubectl patch users <USERNAME> -p '{"spec":{"password":"<YOURPASSWORD>"}}' --type='merge' && kubectl annotate users <USERNAME> iam.kubesphere.io/password-encrypted-

item.title: Enable and Disable Users
item.description:
This section explains how to enable and disable users.

After a user is disabled, it will be unable to log in to the KubeSphere web console.

Prerequisites

You should have User Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Enable and Disable a Single User

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the User Management permission.

  2. Click Users and Roles.

  3. Click Users in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click to the right of a user, and then select Enable or Disable from the dropdown list.

item.title: Delete Users
item.description:
This section explains how to delete users.

Prerequisites

You should have the User Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, please refer to Users and Platform Roles.

Delete a Single User

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the User Management permission.

  2. Click Users and Roles.

  3. Click Users in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click next to the user you want to delete, then choose Delete from the drop-down list.

  5. In the Delete User dialog, enter the user’s name, then click OK.
